Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
A SynchroTech recruta Data Analyst para cliente no setor energético, localizado na região de Lisboa.

FUNÇÃO

  • Realizar análise e modelação de dados em ambientes de Data Warehouse, garantindo a organização e qualidade dos dados;
  • Criar User Stories para projetos relacionados ao Data Warehouse, facilitando o entendimento entre equipas técnicas e de negócio;
  • Extrair, transformar e analisar dados adhoc provenientes de sistemas comerciais e analíticos, gerando insights relevantes para a tomada de decisão;
  • Trabalhar com SQL para consultas e manipulação de dados, e com Excel avançado para elaboração de relatórios e análises;
  • Colaborar com equipas multidisciplinares, aplicando pensamento analítico e criatividade para resolver problemas complexos e propor soluções inovadoras.

LOCAL E HORÁRIO

  • Lisboa.
  • 40h/semanais.
  • Regime híbrido (1x por semana/ 1x de 15 em 15 dias).

REQUISITOS

  • Até 5 anos de experiência.
  • Conhecimento em linguagem SQL, ferramentas Office e em particular Excel nível avançado.
  • Capacidade analítica e de comunicação, relacionamento interpessoal, criatividade, iniciativa e proatividade são as competências que privilegiamos.
  • Experiência em criação de User Stories para o Data Warehouse.
  • Experiência em modelação de dados no Data Warehouse.
  • Experiência em Levantamento de dados adhoc provenientes de sistemas comerciais e/ou analíticos.

CONDIÇÕES

  • Vencimento Mensal;
  • Regime híbrido;
  • Subsídio de Alimentação;
  • Formação contínua;
  • Seguro de saúde;
  • Dias de férias extra;
  • Apoio em formações e desenvolvimento profissional;
  • Seguro de vida.

Os candidatos interessados devem submeter o CV atualizado.

SynchroTech by Egor

Success through People

Os candidatos considerados serão contactados num prazo máximo de 10 dias úteis.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Req Number: 88940

Time Type: Full Time

PLEASE REMEMBER TO CLICK "APPLY" BUTTON AFTER SAVING YOUR PROFILE TO COMPLETE YOUR APPLICATION PROCESS.

Your responsibilities:



Perform in-depth data profiling and analysis to uncover patterns, anomalies, and inconsistencies in data.
Collaborate with data engineers, data scientists, and business analysts to define data requirements and ensure data quality.
Develop and execute data validation and verification processes to document and improve data integrity and quality.
Create detailed reports and visualizations to communicate data profiling results and insights.
Provide recommendations for improving data quality, consistency, and usability.



Our requirements:



Bachelor's degree in Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related field.
Minimum 2–4 years of experience in data profiling, data analysis, or a similar role.
Proficiency in SQL for querying and analysing large datasets.
Experience with data profiling tools (e.g., Databricks, or similar).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent communication skills to effectively present findings to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Familiarity with data quality frameworks and concepts such as data cleansing, data governance, and master data management.
Knowledge of programming languages like Python or R for data analysis (preferred). Excellent level of written and spoken English



What we offer:



Challenges in an international environment
Career development opportunities
Internal training catalogue
Permanent contract
Private medical care
Comprehensive onboarding program
Buddy
Scandinavian work culture
Work-life balance
Culture of feedback
Work schedule 35h/week
Hybrid and flexible work
Good access to public transports



DSV - Transporte Global e Logística

A DSV é um local de trabalho dinâmico que promove a inclusão e a diversidade. Conduzimos os nossos negócios com integridade, respeitando as diferentes culturas, dignidade e os direitos dos indivíduos. Ao ingressar na DSV, você estará a trabalhar para uma das empresas com melhor desempenho no setor de transporte e logística. Você irá juntar-se a uma equipe talentosa com aproximadamente 75.000 colaboradores em mais de 80 países, trabalhando com paixão para oferecer ótimas experiências aos clientes e serviços de alta qualidade. A DSV aspira liderar o caminho para um futuro mais sustentável para nossa indústria e está comprometida em negociar respeitando os termos da natureza.

Promovemos a colaboração e transparência e esforçamo-nos para atrair, motivar e reter pessoas talentosas numa cultura de respeito. Se você é motivado, talentoso e deseja fazer parte de uma organização progressiva e versátil, apoiá-lo-emos nas suas necessidades para alcançar o seu potencial e avançar na sua carreira.

Visite dsv.com e siga-nos no LinkedIn, Facebook e Twitter.

Title: Data Analyst - Trainee Collections & Recoveries
Description:
Country: Portugal

Localização: Lisboa

Descrição Geral da Função

A Área de Collection and Recoveries está a procurar um Trainee para reforçar a sua equipa com um perfil de Data Analytics, que trabalhará sob a supervisão do Manager da área.

Principais Responsabilidades


Usar ferramentas de exploração, tratamento e extração de dados de diferentes fontes (principalmente SAS e SQL Developer);
Desenhar e criar dashboards para melhorar a visualização de dados e KPI’s que deem suporte as decisões e estratégias de negócio a implementar;
Capacidade analítica e interpretação de dados para construir estatísticas que permitam ao negócio tomar decisões ponderadas e sustentadas;
Colaborar com as áreas de negócio para a partilha de informação e discussão que envolvam dados e as suas fontes de informação;
Participar no desenvolvimento de iniciativas de transformação de negócio relacionadas com as carteiras de crédito e a recuperação de crédito para diferentes segmentos de clientes;


Requisitos


Percurso académico em Matemática, Estatística, Econometria, Gestão, Economia, Engenharia ou semelhante
Conhecimentos de exploração e análise de dados (SAS Guide, SQL, Python, R ou semelhante);
Bons conhecimentos de MS-Office, nomeadamente Excel e PowerPoint;
Idiomas: Inglês (valoriza-se conhecimentos em Espanhol).
Perfil técnico com forte capacidade de otimização processos de extração de informação adaptadas aos requisitos de negócio
Perfil analítico com fortes capacidades para resolução de problemas
Autonomia, rigor, proatividade e orientação para resultados
Comunicação clara, empática e eficiente, adaptada aos diferentes stakeholders
Capacidade para trabalhar num ambiente multidisciplinar e colaborativo


Sobre nós

No Santander cada um de nós é “Risk Pro”. Isto significa ter a responsabilidade pessoal de identificar, avaliar, gerir e reportar eventuais riscos para o banco decorrentes do desempenho das nossas funções. Vamos dar-te o conhecimento e as ferramentas para seres Risk Pro em todas as situações. Esta cultura de riscos é fundamental para o Santander Way, a nossa forma de trabalhar.

O Banco dispõe, nos termos do previsto na Lei nº 93/2021 de 20 de dezembro, de um canal de denúncias – Canal Aberto, acessível através do link https://secure.ethicspoint.eu/domain/media/pteu/gui/105862/index.html
Show more
HTML:
Country: Portugal

Localização: Lisboa

Descrição Geral da Função

A Área de Collection and Recoveries está a procurar um Trainee para reforçar a sua equipa com um perfil de Data Analytics, que trabalhará sob a supervisão do Manager da área.

Principais Responsabilidades

  • Usar ferramentas de exploração, tratamento e extração de dados de diferentes fontes (principalmente SAS e SQL Developer);
  • Desenhar e criar dashboards para melhorar a visualização de dados e KPI’s que deem suporte as decisões e estratégias de negócio a implementar;
  • Capacidade analítica e interpretação de dados para construir estatísticas que permitam ao negócio tomar decisões ponderadas e sustentadas;
  • Colaborar com as áreas de negócio para a partilha de informação e discussão que envolvam dados e as suas fontes de informação;
  • Participar no desenvolvimento de iniciativas de transformação de negócio relacionadas com as carteiras de crédito e a recuperação de crédito para diferentes segmentos de clientes;

Requisitos

  • Percurso académico em Matemática, Estatística, Econometria, Gestão, Economia, Engenharia ou semelhante
  • Conhecimentos de exploração e análise de dados (SAS Guide, SQL, Python, R ou semelhante);
  • Bons conhecimentos de MS-Office, nomeadamente Excel e PowerPoint;
  • Idiomas: Inglês (valoriza-se conhecimentos em Espanhol).
  • Perfil técnico com forte capacidade de otimização processos de extração de informação adaptadas aos requisitos de negócio
  • Perfil analítico com fortes capacidades para resolução de problemas
  • Autonomia, rigor, proatividade e orientação para resultados
  • Comunicação clara, empática e eficiente, adaptada aos diferentes stakeholders
  • Capacidade para trabalhar num ambiente multidisciplinar e colaborativo

Sobre nós

No Santander cada um de nós é “Risk Pro”. Isto significa ter a responsabilidade pessoal de identificar, avaliar, gerir e reportar eventuais riscos para o banco decorrentes do desempenho das nossas funções. Vamos dar-te o conhecimento e as ferramentas para seres Risk Pro em todas as situações. Esta cultura de riscos é fundamental para o Santander Way, a nossa forma de trabalhar.

O Banco dispõe, nos termos do previsto na Lei nº 93/2021 de 20 de dezembro, de um canal de denúncias – Canal Aberto, acessível através do link https://secure.ethicspoint.eu/domain/media/pteu/gui/105862/index.html

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Back in 1966, in Marseilles, when the world was talking about Start Trek 🚀, Sodexo was serving its first customers, initiating our journey in the Quality-of-Life Services leaded by the bold Pierre Bellon.




Since then, we continued our adventure of offering everyday need solutions, improving the life of our users across the globe 🌎 supported by more than 400 thousand dedicated and brave colleagues, in 64 countries, that lead us to where we are today.




🇵🇹 Portugal is no exception and 5 years ago, our shared service center – Sodexo Business Services – SBS, was born! In here, you will have the chance to be part of several 📊🧾Financial teams like Record to Report, Order to Cash, Purchase to Pay, Financial Analysis, Master Data, among others, that support European markets, making sure the business continues to growth.







💥 Are you bold enough to join our crew, with your unique character and ideas, and make us even bigger?




💼 We are waiting for you! And so, your career!




In the meantime, check the opportunity below:




Data Analyst




This position is responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting complex data to help drive strategic decisions and optimize business processes. The role involves transforming raw data into actionable insights, developing reports and dashboards, and supporting the organization in identifying trends and opportunities for growth.




⚙ What will you do?

Collaborating with teams to understand their needs and expectations, and to provide them with data analytics support and recommendations.
Create, restructure, and manage large datasets, files, and systems.
Develop clear, actionable visualizations through Power BI dashboards.
Collecting, processing and analyzing data from various sources and systems, using tools such as SQL, Power BI, Python, R, Tableau, etc.
Filter, clean, and validate data, ensuring data accuracy and implementing performance indicators to identify and correct issues.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets with minimal guidance.
Present findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise communication.
Identifying, assessing and monitoring key risks and controls, using data analytics techniques such as descriptive, diagnostic, predictive and prescriptive analytics.
Performing data quality checks and ensuring data integrity and reliability.
Staying abreast of the latest trends and developments in data analytics and sharing best practices and knowledge
Build stakeholder understanding of data usage and its impact on business decisions.




🤙 What you'll need to succeed?:

Bachelor's/Master's degree in data/computer science, statistics, mathematics, engineering, or a related field.
2/3 years relevant experience
Strong Power BI experience (data visualization/reporting)
Strong data manipulation, transformation, query languages knowledge (SQL, Power BI, Python, R, Tableau, DBT, Databricks)
Good understanding of statistical methods (statistical software exp. is a plus)
Fluent in English, both written and spoken.
Excellent communication skills to explain data insights and their business impact to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to translate business needs into data models/analytics solutions.
Analytical with attention to detail and accuracy.
Problem-solving & methodical
Autonomous & multitasker
Proactive with a passion for continuous learning and staying updated on new technologies and methodologies




🎉 What we have to offer you?

Hybrid working model;
Flexible working hours;
Health & Life Insurance;
Attractive Meal allowance paid in Meal Card;
Additional Days off: extra vacation day, employee’s birthday, volunteering day;
More than 6000 free online courses;
Opportunity to grow professionally inside the Company;
Possibility to participate in multicultural projects;
Several internal activities aiming to promote our team´s wellbeing.




We are waiting for you!




Send us your CV to our email Recruitment.SBS.Portugal@sodexo.com with the title of the role on the subject and check all the opportunities on our career website (https://www.sodexo.com/en/contact-us/sbs-porto/porto-jobs)




Find out more about Sodexo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XX7PoE9kazU




Sodexo is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

At Sodexo we believe in Privacy and your Privacy is very important to us that´s why your personal data will only be used for the purpose of managing our recruitment process, will be processed in accordance to the GDPR and treated confidentially. For further information about how we process your personal data please reach out to privacy.sbs@sodexo.com.

Title: Data Intern
Description:
At adidas Porto, our diverse team of over 900 employees, representing 40 nationalities, creates a powerful mix of global talent. Located in Maia, Porto, this location covers key areas such as Finance, Procurement, Accounts & Sales Ops, HR & Payroll, Supply Chain, Digital, Tech, and Data, among others.

We are running internships in 3 different Data areas: Data Science, Machine Learning, and Product Ownership.


As a Data Science intern, you'll support a proof of concept for Advanced Analytics within adidas' global supply chain. Your focus may include exploring machine learning applications for areas like global sourcing and customs, as well as potential uses of Generative AI.
As a Machine Learning intern, you’ll help bridge the gap between advanced AI research and practical, scalable solutions, empowering businesses across various domains. Join a project focused on designing user-friendly tools and frameworks to bring Generative AI into real-world industry applications.
As a Data Product Owner intern, you'll support the Demand Planning team by gathering and translating business requirements into Jira stories for the data engineering team. You'll work closely with stakeholders to ensure the requirements are clear, actionable, and aligned with project goals. Your role will also involve prioritizing tasks and ensuring smooth team communication to drive efficient product development.


WHO ARE WE LOOKING FOR?


Master's students in statistics, physics, mathematics, IT, system engineering, or related.
Enrolled in a Portuguese university and eligible for a curricular internship.
Fluency in English, both verbal and written.


WHAT IS IN IT FOR YOU?


A paid internship up to 9 months with other adidas benefits.
Hybrid work policy and flexible working hours.
A sports-driven, international and diverse work environment.
State-of-art office space and conditions.


HOW WILL THE RECRUITMENT PROCESS BE?


Step 1. Apply with your English Resume.
Step 2. You'll receive a WePow for a pre-recorded video interview.
Step 3. You'll be invited for an on-site interview in our office.


The start date for this internship will be March 10th 2025.

adidas celebrates diversity, supports inclusiveness and encourages individual expression in our workplace. We do not tolerate the harassment or discrimination toward any of our applicants or employees. We are an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Data Analyst
HTML:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:


Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.


Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.


Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.


At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.


We are looking for a Data Analyst for a project based in Porto (Hybrid work model - twice a week at the office).


Requirements:

• BS/MS Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area;

• Experience in data preparation and data reconciliation (mandatory);

• Experience in Alteryx and VBA;

• Power BI Experience;

• Good knowledge of SQL (mandatory);

• Good knowledge of Agile and Scrum methodologies;

• Fluent English (mandatory);

• The candidate must be living in Portugal (mandatory).


Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.
